subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Sacred Rituals: How Religions Mark Time
description: A quick, practical guide to Sacred Rituals: How Religions Mark Time.

hook.text: Muslims pray five times daily. Jews rest on Saturday. Christians worship Sunday. Rituals make ordinary time sacred.

buildup.text: Hindu puja involves offerings of flowers, food, and light before images of gods ‚Äî transforming homes into temples.

discovery.text: Buddhist meditation retreats can last months. Monks may sit in silence for 10 hours daily seeking enlightenment.

twist.text: Rituals look different across religions but serve the same purpose: connecting the ordinary self to the transcendent.

climax.text: Without ritual, religion becomes just philosophy. Ritual is what turns belief into lived, embodied practice.

punchline.text: Five prayers, a Sabbath rest, silent meditation. Rituals make faith real.

quiz.question: What function do rituals serve across all religions?
options: Connecting ordinary life to the transcendent
